Prototrade
  • Quickstart
  • View page source

Quickstart

  1. Use pip install prototrade -U to install the latest version of the package

  2. Create a new python file (e.g. script.py) and paste in the minimal boilerplate strategy .

  3. Use python3 script.py to run the boilerplate code. Refer to the Key Points below for an explanation

  4. Look at the example strategies section for more ideas of how the framework operates.

Creating a Strategy Function

Below are the key components needed for creating a strategy. See the minimal boilerplate strategy for an example.

  • Import the VirtualExchange

  • Create a strategy function, following the same format as the boilerplate strategy. This will take in an Exchange object as its first argument. The Exchange parameter is how a strategy can retrieve the latest quotes for subscribed stocks and place orders for symbols.

  • The strategy function can also take as many other arguments as desired.

  • Subscribe to desired symbols using the subscribe member function of the Exchange object.

  • Create a while loop that repeatedly checks whether the exchange is running with the member function is_running

Retrieving Stock data

  • To (un)subscribe to particular symbols, use the subscribe and unsubscribe <prototrade.exchange.exchange.Exchange.unsubscribe> functions

  • Use get_subscribed_quotes to get the latest quotes for all the stocks that are subscribed to.

  • To access historical data use the Historical Property.

Placing Orders

  • To submit orders, use the create_order member function.

  • Orders can be cancelled with the cancel_order member function.

  • See the Exchange for more functions.

Registering Strategies for execution

  • Ensure the VirtualExchange class has been imported

  • In a main() function, create an instance of the VirtualExchange class

  • Use the member function, register_strategy to register a function/strategy to the framework VirtualExchange

  • When all strategies are registered, use the member function, run_strategies to start the simulated execution of the strategies.

Common Errors

  • Ensure that the Python script is starting using format below. Otherwise a freeze_support error can occur.

if __name__ == '__main__':
   main()
